speaker: Cashier
text: Did you find everything you were looking for today?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes I did thank you. Do you have any paper bags?

speaker: Cashier
text: We do. Would you like paper or plastic?

speaker: Customer
text: Paper please. And I have my own reusable bags too.

speaker: Cashier
text: Great. Your total comes to forty-seven dollars and thirty-two cents.

speaker: Customer
text: Here you go. Can I get cash back?

speaker: Cashier
text: Sure. How much would you like?

speaker: Customer
text: Twenty dollars please.

speaker: Pharmacist
text: Hi there. How can I help you today?

speaker: Customer
text: I'm here to pick up a prescription for Johnson.

speaker: Pharmacist
text: First name and date of birth please?

speaker: Customer
text: Sarah Johnson. March fifteenth nineteen seventy-two.

speaker: Pharmacist
text: Let me check. Yes we have it ready. Have you taken this medication before?

speaker: Customer
text: No this is the first time.

speaker: Pharmacist
text: Would you like to speak with the pharmacist about any questions?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes please. I'd like to know about possible side effects.

speaker: Server
text: Good evening. Welcome to Mario's. Can I start you off with something to drink?

speaker: Customer
text: I'll have a glass of water and an iced tea please.

speaker: Server
text: Sweetened or unsweetened for the tea?

speaker: Customer
text: Unsweetened please. Do you have any specials tonight?

speaker: Server
text: Yes. Tonight we have grilled salmon with roasted vegetables.

speaker: Customer
text: That sounds good. I'll have the salmon special.

speaker: Server
text: Excellent choice. Would you like a salad or soup to start?

speaker: Customer
text: The house salad with ranch dressing on the side please.

speaker: Teller
text: Hello. How can I help you today?

speaker: Customer
text: I'd like to make a deposit into my checking account.

speaker: Teller
text: May I have your account number or your ID please?

speaker: Customer
text: Here's my driver's license.

speaker: Teller
text: Thank you Mr. Williams. How much would you like to deposit?

speaker: Customer
text: Five hundred dollars. Three hundred in cash and a check for two hundred.

speaker: Teller
text: The cash will be available immediately. The check will clear in two business days.

speaker: Customer
text: That's fine. Can I also get my current balance?

speaker: Passenger
text: Excuse me does this bus go to the downtown transit center?

speaker: Driver
text: Yes it does. We'll be there in about twenty minutes.

speaker: Passenger
text: Will you announce the stop or should I watch for it?

speaker: Driver
text: I announce all major stops. Downtown is stop number fourteen.

speaker: Passenger
text: Thank you. Is there a transfer point there for the eastside routes?

speaker: Driver
text: Yes. Routes fifteen and twenty-three both connect there.

speaker: Passenger
text: Great. I'll watch for the downtown stop. What time does the last bus run?

speaker: Driver
text: The last bus leaves downtown at eleven thirty on weeknights.

speaker: Receptionist
text: Good morning. Do you have an appointment today?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes I have a ten o'clock with Doctor Patel.

speaker: Receptionist
text: Your name please?

speaker: Patient
text: Michael Thompson.

speaker: Receptionist
text: I found you. Has your insurance information changed since your last visit?

speaker: Patient
text: No it's still the same.

speaker: Receptionist
text: Please have a seat. The doctor will be with you shortly.

speaker: Patient
text: Thank you. Is there a copay I need to pay today?

speaker: Stylist
text: Hi there. What are we doing for you today?

speaker: Customer
text: I'd like a trim and maybe some layers added.

speaker: Stylist
text: How much length do you want to take off?

speaker: Customer
text: About an inch. I want to keep most of the length.

speaker: Stylist
text: Sounds good. Do you want me to style it after or just blow dry?

speaker: Customer
text: Just a simple blow dry is fine.

speaker: Stylist
text: Would you like to schedule your next appointment before you leave?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes please. Same time next month would be perfect.

speaker: Employee
text: Hi. Picking up or dropping off today?

speaker: Customer
text: Picking up. The last name is Garcia.

speaker: Employee
text: Do you have your ticket?

speaker: Customer
text: I think I lost it. I dropped off a suit and two shirts last week.

speaker: Employee
text: No problem. Can I see your ID?

speaker: Customer
text: Sure. Here you go.

speaker: Employee
text: I found it. That will be twenty-three fifty.

speaker: Customer
text: Here you go. Thank you for finding it without the ticket.

speaker: Clerk
text: Next please. How can I help you?

speaker: Customer
text: I need to mail this package to California.

speaker: Clerk
text: Would you like regular mail or priority?

speaker: Customer
text: How long does each take?

speaker: Clerk
text: Regular is five to seven days. Priority is two to three days.

speaker: Customer
text: Priority please. I need it there by Friday.

speaker: Clerk
text: Is there anything fragile or liquid inside?

speaker: Customer
text: No just books and some documents.

speaker: Staff
text: Welcome to FitLife. Are you interested in a membership?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes. I'd like to learn about your options.

speaker: Staff
text: We have monthly and annual plans. Annual saves you twenty percent.

speaker: Customer
text: What's included in the basic membership?

speaker: Staff
text: Full access to all equipment and group classes. Personal training is extra.

speaker: Customer
text: Can I try it for a day first?

speaker: Staff
text: Absolutely. I can give you a free day pass right now.

speaker: Customer
text: That would be great. Where are the locker rooms?

speaker: Clerk
text: Good evening. Welcome to the Grand Hotel. Checking in?

speaker: Guest
text: Yes. I have a reservation under the name Parker.

speaker: Clerk
text: Yes I see it here. A king room for two nights?

speaker: Guest
text: That's correct.

speaker: Clerk
text: May I see your ID and a credit card for incidentals?

speaker: Guest
text: Here you are. What time is checkout?

speaker: Clerk
text: Checkout is at eleven. Would you like a wake-up call?

speaker: Guest
text: Yes please. Seven in the morning.

speaker: Librarian
text: Can I help you find something?

speaker: Patron
text: Yes I'm looking for books about gardening.

speaker: Librarian
text: We have a whole section on that. Follow me.

speaker: Patron
text: I'm particularly interested in vegetable gardening.

speaker: Librarian
text: These three books are very popular with beginners.

speaker: Patron
text: Thank you. How long can I keep them?

speaker: Librarian
text: Three weeks. You can renew online if you need more time.

speaker: Patron
text: That's very helpful. I'll start with these three. Thank you.

speaker: Baker
text: Good morning. What can I get for you?

speaker: Customer
text: I'd like two croissants and a blueberry muffin please.

speaker: Baker
text: Fresh out of the oven. Anything else?

speaker: Customer
text: Do you have any gluten-free options?

speaker: Baker
text: Yes we have gluten-free brownies and cookies.

speaker: Customer
text: I'll take two brownies as well.

speaker: Baker
text: Your total is twelve seventy-five. For here or to go?

speaker: Customer
text: To go please.

speaker: Clerk
text: Who's next? What can I get for you?

speaker: Customer
text: Half a pound of turkey breast please.

speaker: Clerk
text: Thin sliced or regular?

speaker: Customer
text: Thin sliced. And a quarter pound of swiss cheese.

speaker: Clerk
text: Here's a sample of the turkey. Is that sliced thin enough?

speaker: Customer
text: Perfect. Thank you.

speaker: Clerk
text: Anything else today?

speaker: Customer
text: That's all thanks.

speaker: Cashier
text: Welcome to Star Cinema. What movie would you like to see?

speaker: Customer
text: Two tickets for the seven o'clock showing of The Great Adventure.

speaker: Cashier
text: That's in theater five. Would you like regular or IMAX?

speaker: Customer
text: Regular is fine. What's the price difference?

speaker: Cashier
text: IMAX is six dollars more per ticket.

speaker: Customer
text: We'll stick with regular. Can we pick our seats?

speaker: Cashier
text: Yes. The screen shows available seats in blue.

speaker: Customer
text: Row G seats ten and eleven please.

speaker: Receptionist
text: Good afternoon. Welcome to Bright Smiles Dental.

speaker: Patient
text: Hi. I have a two-thirty appointment.

speaker: Receptionist
text: Name please?

speaker: Patient
text: Jennifer Adams.

speaker: Receptionist
text: I see you. Is this for your regular cleaning?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes and I've been having some sensitivity in my back teeth.

speaker: Receptionist
text: I'll make a note for the dentist. Please fill out this form about your symptoms.

speaker: Patient
text: Thank you. Where should I wait?

speaker: Technician
text: Come on in. We'll start with some preliminary tests.

speaker: Patient
text: What kind of tests?

speaker: Technician
text: Just checking your eye pressure and taking some measurements.

speaker: Patient
text: Will that hurt?

speaker: Technician
text: Not at all. You might feel a small puff of air.

speaker: Patient
text: Okay. My vision seems blurrier lately especially at night.

speaker: Technician
text: The doctor will check that thoroughly. When did you notice the change?

speaker: Patient
text: About two months ago. It's gotten gradually worse.

speaker: Advisor
text: Good morning. Do you have an appointment with us today?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes I called yesterday about my brakes making a squealing noise.

speaker: Advisor
text: Let me pull up your information. Is this for the silver sedan?

speaker: Customer
text: That's right. It started about two weeks ago.

speaker: Advisor
text: We'll take a look at the brake pads and rotors. It should take about two hours.

speaker: Customer
text: Do you have a waiting area or should I come back?

speaker: Advisor
text: We have a lounge with coffee and wifi. I'll update you when it's ready.

speaker: Customer
text: Great. Can you also check the oil level while it's in?

speaker: Agent
text: Thank you for calling tech support. How can I help you today?

speaker: Caller
text: My internet has been very slow since yesterday morning.

speaker: Agent
text: I'm sorry to hear that. Can you tell me the model number on your router?

speaker: Caller
text: It says N-three-hundred on the bottom label.

speaker: Agent
text: Have you tried unplugging the router and waiting thirty seconds?

speaker: Caller
text: Yes I've done that twice already. It didn't help.

speaker: Agent
text: Let me run a diagnostic from our end. Can you stay on the line for about two minutes?

speaker: Caller
text: Sure. I'll wait.

speaker: Agent
text: Good afternoon. Can I have your policy number please?

speaker: Caller
text: Yes it's H-K-four-seven-two-nine-one.

speaker: Agent
text: Thank you. I see your account. What can I help you with today?

speaker: Caller
text: I need to know if my plan covers hearing devices.

speaker: Agent
text: Let me check your benefits. Your plan does cover hearing devices up to three thousand dollars.

speaker: Caller
text: Is there a copay for the audiologist visit?

speaker: Agent
text: There's a thirty dollar specialist copay per visit. Would you like me to find providers near you?

speaker: Caller
text: Yes please. I'm in the downtown area.

speaker: Agent
text: Next in line please. May I see your passport and booking confirmation?

speaker: Passenger
text: Here you go. I'm on the two fifteen flight to Chicago.

speaker: Agent
text: I see your reservation. Would you like a window or aisle seat?

speaker: Passenger
text: Aisle please if one is available.

speaker: Agent
text: I have fourteen C on the aisle. Are you checking any bags today?

speaker: Passenger
text: Just this one suitcase. Is the flight on time?

speaker: Agent
text: Yes it's on schedule. Your gate is B twelve. Boarding starts at one forty-five.

speaker: Passenger
text: Thank you. Which way is security from here?

speaker: Agent
text: Welcome to the rental counter. Do you have a reservation?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes under the name Johnson. I reserved a mid-size car.

speaker: Agent
text: I found it. Would you like to upgrade to a full-size for ten dollars more per day?

speaker: Customer
text: No thank you. The mid-size is fine.

speaker: Agent
text: Would you like to add insurance coverage?

speaker: Customer
text: What does the basic coverage include?

speaker: Agent
text: It covers collision damage with a five hundred dollar deductible. The full coverage has no deductible.

speaker: Customer
text: I'll take the basic coverage. Where do I pick up the car?

speaker: Employee
text: Hi there. Can I help you find something?

speaker: Customer
text: I'm looking for food for my new kitten. She's about ten weeks old.

speaker: Employee
text: Congratulations on the new kitten. The kitten food is in aisle three.

speaker: Customer
text: Is there a brand you recommend?

speaker: Employee
text: This one is very popular with our customers. It has everything a growing kitten needs.

speaker: Customer
text: How much should I feed her each day?

speaker: Employee
text: At ten weeks about a quarter cup three times a day. The bag has a feeding guide too.

speaker: Customer
text: Perfect. I also need a small litter box if you have one.

speaker: Instructor
text: Welcome. Are you here for the morning yoga class?

speaker: Member
text: Yes. This is my first time. Do I need to sign in somewhere?

speaker: Instructor
text: Just put your name on the sheet by the door. Have you done yoga before?

speaker: Member
text: A few times at home with videos. Never in a real class.

speaker: Instructor
text: You'll do great. Grab a mat from the shelf over there.

speaker: Member
text: Should I take my shoes off?

speaker: Instructor
text: Yes please. And feel free to modify any pose that's uncomfortable. Listen to your body.

speaker: Member
text: Thanks. What time does the class end?

speaker: Employee
text: What can I help you with today?

speaker: Customer
text: I need wiper blades for a twenty twenty-two Honda Civic.

speaker: Employee
text: Let me look that up. You'll need a twenty-six inch for the driver side and an eighteen for the passenger.

speaker: Customer
text: Do you have different quality levels?

speaker: Employee
text: We have standard and premium. The premium ones last about twice as long.

speaker: Customer
text: I'll go with the premium. Can you show me how to install them?

speaker: Employee
text: Sure. It's really easy. You just lift the arm and press the release tab.

speaker: Customer
text: Great. I'll take both. Do you have windshield washer fluid too?

speaker: Preparer
text: Good to see you again. Did you bring all your documents?

speaker: Client
text: I have my W-two and the mortgage interest statement. I think that's everything.

speaker: Preparer
text: Did you have any medical expenses this year?

speaker: Client
text: Yes actually. I had hearing device expenses totaling about four thousand dollars.

speaker: Preparer
text: Those may be deductible. Do you have the receipts?

speaker: Client
text: I have them right here in this folder.

speaker: Preparer
text: Perfect. Based on what I see so far you should expect a refund this year.

speaker: Client
text: That's good news. How long until I receive it?

speaker: Agent
text: This is the two-bedroom unit I mentioned. It was renovated last year.

speaker: Client
text: The kitchen looks nice. Is the dishwasher new?

speaker: Agent
text: Everything in the kitchen was replaced including the appliances and countertops.

speaker: Client
text: What floor is this on?

speaker: Agent
text: Third floor. There's an elevator in the building. The lease is twelve months.

speaker: Client
text: Are utilities included in the rent?

speaker: Agent
text: Water and trash are included. You'd pay for electricity and internet separately.

speaker: Client
text: Can I see the bedroom? And is there parking available?

speaker: Interviewer
text: Thank you for coming in today. Please have a seat.

speaker: Candidate
text: Thank you. I'm excited to learn more about the position.

speaker: Interviewer
text: Tell me about your experience in customer service.

speaker: Candidate
text: I worked at a retail store for three years handling returns and helping customers find products.

speaker: Interviewer
text: What would you say is your greatest strength?

speaker: Candidate
text: I'm a good listener and I stay calm when things get busy.

speaker: Interviewer
text: When could you start if offered the position?

speaker: Candidate
text: I could start in two weeks. I'd need to give notice at my current job.

speaker: Teacher
text: Thanks for coming in. Your daughter is doing very well in reading.

speaker: Parent
text: That's great to hear. She reads at home every night before bed.

speaker: Teacher
text: I can tell. Her vocabulary has improved a lot this semester.

speaker: Parent
text: How is she doing in math?

speaker: Teacher
text: Math is her weaker area. She sometimes struggles with word problems.

speaker: Parent
text: Is there anything we can practice at home?

speaker: Teacher
text: I'll send home some worksheets. Ten minutes a day makes a big difference.

speaker: Parent
text: We'll do that. Does she get along well with the other children?

speaker: Dispatcher
text: Roadside assistance. What's your location?

speaker: Caller
text: I'm on Highway twenty-seven about two miles south of the Elm Street exit.

speaker: Dispatcher
text: What seems to be the problem?

speaker: Caller
text: I have a flat tire on the right rear. I don't have a spare.

speaker: Dispatcher
text: Are you in a safe location off the road?

speaker: Caller
text: Yes I pulled onto the shoulder. My hazard lights are on.

speaker: Dispatcher
text: Good. I'm sending a tow truck. It should arrive in about thirty to forty-five minutes.

speaker: Caller
text: Thank you. Should I stay in the car or wait outside?

speaker: Employee
text: Welcome. Can I take your order?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes. Can I get a number three combo with no onions?

speaker: Employee
text: Sure. What size drink would you like?

speaker: Customer
text: Medium please. And could I get that with a lemonade instead of soda?

speaker: Employee
text: Lemonade is fine. Anything else?

speaker: Customer
text: Can I also add a small fry on the side?

speaker: Employee
text: Got it. Your total is nine forty-seven. Please pull forward to the first window.

speaker: Customer
text: Thank you. Do you take contactless payment?

speaker: Receptionist
text: Hi there. Welcome to the animal clinic. What's your pet's name?

speaker: Owner
text: This is Daisy. She has an appointment at ten thirty.

speaker: Receptionist
text: I see Daisy's appointment right here. Is this just a regular checkup?

speaker: Owner
text: Mostly. But she's also been scratching her ears a lot lately.

speaker: Receptionist
text: The doctor will take a look at that. Is Daisy up to date on her vaccinations?

speaker: Owner
text: I think so but I'm not sure about the rabies shot.

speaker: Receptionist
text: We'll check her records. Please have a seat and the vet will be right with you.

speaker: Owner
text: Thank you. She gets a little nervous at the vet so I'll keep her on the leash.

speaker: Associate
text: Hi. How can I help you today?

speaker: Customer
text: I'd like to return this sweater. It doesn't fit right.

speaker: Associate
text: Do you have the receipt?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes here it is. I bought it last Saturday.

speaker: Associate
text: That's within our thirty day return window. Would you like a refund or exchange?

speaker: Customer
text: I'd like to exchange it for a larger size if you have one.

speaker: Associate
text: Let me check the back. We might have a large in the same color.

speaker: Customer
text: Thank you. If not I'll just take the refund.

speaker: Barista
text: Good morning. What can I get started for you?

speaker: Customer
text: Can I get a large latte with oat milk?

speaker: Barista
text: Sure. Hot or iced?

speaker: Customer
text: Hot please. And can you make it with an extra shot?

speaker: Barista
text: Large hot oat milk latte with an extra shot. Anything else?

speaker: Customer
text: Actually yes. Can I also get a blueberry muffin?

speaker: Barista
text: Of course. Your total is eight twenty-five. Name for the order?

speaker: Customer
text: It's Sarah. Thanks.

speaker: Vendor
text: Good morning. Would you like to try a sample of our honey?

speaker: Customer
text: Sure. Oh that's delicious. How much for a jar?

speaker: Vendor
text: The small jar is eight dollars and the large is fourteen.

speaker: Customer
text: I'll take a large one. Do you also sell beeswax candles?

speaker: Vendor
text: We do. They're right here. Six dollars each or two for ten.

speaker: Customer
text: I'll take two please. Do you accept cards?

speaker: Vendor
text: Cash or card is fine. Would you like a bag?

speaker: Customer
text: No thanks I brought my own. See you next week.

speaker: System
text: Welcome to telephone banking. Please enter your account number followed by the pound key.

speaker: Caller
text: I'd rather speak to a representative please.

speaker: Agent
text: Thank you for your patience. I can help you. May I have your account number?

speaker: Caller
text: It's seven-two-four-eight-three-one-zero.

speaker: Agent
text: For security can you verify the last four digits of your social security number?

speaker: Caller
text: Five-nine-two-one.

speaker: Agent
text: Thank you. Your checking account balance is two thousand three hundred forty-seven dollars. Is there anything else?

speaker: Caller
text: Can you also tell me if my direct deposit went through this week?

speaker: Neighbor
text: Hey there. Your garden looks amazing this year.

speaker: Resident
text: Thanks. I planted some new tomatoes and peppers this spring.

speaker: Neighbor
text: I've been thinking about starting a garden. Is it a lot of work?

speaker: Resident
text: Not really once you get it set up. Watering takes about fifteen minutes a day.

speaker: Neighbor
text: Did you hear about the block party next Saturday?

speaker: Resident
text: I saw the flyer. What time does it start?

speaker: Neighbor
text: Four o'clock. They're closing off the street. Everyone's bringing food to share.

speaker: Resident
text: Sounds fun. I'll bring some of these tomatoes if they're ripe by then.

speaker: Cashier
text: Hi. What pump number?

speaker: Customer
text: Pump number five. Can I get thirty dollars on regular?

speaker: Cashier
text: Thirty on pump five. Cash or card?

speaker: Customer
text: Cash. Here's a fifty. I'll need change back.

speaker: Cashier
text: Your change is twenty dollars. Do you need anything else?

speaker: Customer
text: Can I also get a bottle of water?

speaker: Cashier
text: That'll be a dollar seventy-five. Eighteen twenty-five is your new change.

speaker: Customer
text: Thanks. Is the restroom around back?

speaker: Receptionist
text: Good morning. Doctor Miller's office. How can I help you?

speaker: Caller
text: I'd like to schedule a checkup appointment please.

speaker: Receptionist
text: Of course. Are you an existing patient?

speaker: Caller
text: Yes. My last name is Thompson.

speaker: Receptionist
text: I see your file. We have openings next Tuesday at nine or Thursday at two thirty.

speaker: Caller
text: Thursday at two thirty works better for me.

speaker: Receptionist
text: You're all set. Please arrive fifteen minutes early to fill out updated forms.

speaker: Caller
text: Will do. Do I need to bring my insurance card?

speaker: Driver
text: Hi. I have a delivery for this address. Are you the homeowner?

speaker: Resident
text: Yes that's me. I've been expecting this package.

speaker: Driver
text: Can you sign here on the screen please?

speaker: Resident
text: Sure. Is this the only box or are there more?

speaker: Driver
text: There's one more in the truck. It's a bit heavy. Where would you like it?

speaker: Resident
text: Just inside the front door would be great.

speaker: Driver
text: Here you go. Both packages are delivered. Have a nice day.

speaker: Resident
text: Thank you so much. I appreciate the help with the heavy one.

speaker: Teller
text: Good afternoon. How can I help you today?

speaker: Customer
text: I need to send a wire transfer to my daughter's account in Portland.

speaker: Teller
text: I can help with that. Do you have the routing number and account number for the receiving bank?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes. The routing number is zero-two-one-zero-zero-zero-zero-eight-nine and the account is four-seven-three-two-one-six.

speaker: Teller
text: And how much would you like to send?

speaker: Customer
text: Fifteen hundred dollars. How long will it take to arrive?

speaker: Teller
text: Domestic wires typically arrive the same business day. There is a twenty-five dollar fee for the transfer.

speaker: Customer
text: That's fine. Can I get a confirmation receipt when it goes through?

speaker: Clerk
text: Are you here for passport services?

speaker: Applicant
text: Yes. I need to apply for a new passport. Mine expired three years ago.

speaker: Clerk
text: You'll need to fill out form DS-eleven. Did you bring a passport photo and your birth certificate?

speaker: Applicant
text: I have the birth certificate but I still need the photo taken.

speaker: Clerk
text: We can take your photo here for fifteen dollars. The passport application fee is a hundred and thirty.

speaker: Applicant
text: Do you accept credit cards for the fees?

speaker: Clerk
text: We accept cards for the photo but the application fee must be a check or money order payable to the U.S. Department of State.

speaker: Applicant
text: I have a check. How long until I receive the passport?

speaker: Attendant
text: You doing okay over there? Looks like you're having trouble.

speaker: Driver
text: My car won't start. The engine just clicks when I turn the key.

speaker: Attendant
text: That sounds like it could be the battery. How old is it?

speaker: Driver
text: I'm not sure. Maybe four or five years. I haven't replaced it.

speaker: Attendant
text: I can try to jump start it for you. Let me pull my truck around.

speaker: Driver
text: That would be great. Should I pop the hood?

speaker: Attendant
text: Yes go ahead. And there's an auto parts store about two blocks east on Main Street if you need a new battery.

speaker: Driver
text: Thank you so much. I really appreciate the help.

speaker: Mechanic
text: I took a look at your car. I found a couple of things.

speaker: Customer
text: What's going on with it?

speaker: Mechanic
text: Your front brake pads are worn down to about two millimeters. They need to be replaced soon.

speaker: Customer
text: How much would that cost?

speaker: Mechanic
text: Parts and labor come to about three hundred and fifty dollars for both front wheels.

speaker: Customer
text: That's not too bad. Was there anything else?

speaker: Mechanic
text: Your air filter is pretty dirty. I'd recommend replacing it. That's another thirty-five dollars.

speaker: Customer
text: Go ahead and do both. How long will it take?

speaker: Employee
text: Looking at the fish tanks? Are you thinking about starting an aquarium?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes. My kids want fish but I've never had any before.

speaker: Employee
text: I'd recommend starting with a ten-gallon freshwater tank. It's a good beginner size.

speaker: Customer
text: What comes with the starter kit?

speaker: Employee
text: You get the tank a filter a heater and a light. You'll need to buy gravel and decorations separately.

speaker: Customer
text: How many fish can I put in a ten-gallon tank?

speaker: Employee
text: About eight to ten small fish like tetras or guppies. You'll want to add them gradually over a few weeks.

speaker: Customer
text: That sounds perfect. I'll take the starter kit and a bag of blue gravel.

speaker: Associate
text: Welcome in. What brings you in today?

speaker: Customer
text: I need a new pair of running shoes. I've been getting knee pain with my old ones.

speaker: Associate
text: Let me measure your feet first. Sometimes the wrong size causes problems. What size do you usually wear?

speaker: Customer
text: I usually wear a ten and a half.

speaker: Associate
text: You're actually closer to an eleven. That could be why you're having issues. Do you run on pavement or trails?

speaker: Customer
text: Mostly pavement. I run about three miles four times a week.

speaker: Associate
text: I'd suggest this model. It has extra cushioning for road running and good arch support. It's a hundred and thirty-nine dollars.

speaker: Customer
text: Can I try them on? And do you have them in black?

speaker: Agent
text: Thank you for calling. Can I have your name and the model number of your printer?

speaker: Caller
text: My name is Robert Chen. The model is an HP OfficeJet Pro nine-zero-one-five.

speaker: Agent
text: Thank you Robert. What issue are you experiencing?

speaker: Caller
text: It shows offline even though it's connected to my wifi. I've already restarted it twice.

speaker: Agent
text: Let's try removing the printer from your computer and adding it again. Go to Settings then Printers and Scanners.

speaker: Caller
text: Okay I'm there. I see the printer listed. Should I click remove?

speaker: Agent
text: Yes remove it and then click Add Printer. It should detect the OfficeJet on your network automatically.

speaker: Caller
text: It found it. And the status now says ready. That worked. Thank you.

speaker: Contractor
text: Thanks for having me out. You said you have some water damage in the bathroom?

speaker: Homeowner
text: Yes. There's a brown stain on the ceiling below the upstairs bathroom. It appeared about a week ago.

speaker: Contractor
text: I'll need to take a look upstairs. It could be a leaky pipe or a problem with the shower seal.

speaker: Homeowner
text: How much does something like this usually cost to fix?

speaker: Contractor
text: If it's just the shower seal we're looking at about two hundred. A pipe repair could be five hundred or more depending on access.

speaker: Homeowner
text: Do you need to open up the ceiling to find the leak?

speaker: Contractor
text: Possibly. But let me check upstairs first. Sometimes the source is obvious. I'll give you a written estimate before starting any work.

speaker: Homeowner
text: I appreciate that. The bathroom is at the top of the stairs on the left.

speaker: Optician
text: Your exam is finished. Let's go pick out some frames for you.

speaker: Patient
text: The doctor said I need progressive lenses. Does that limit my frame choices?

speaker: Optician
text: Not too much but you'll want a taller frame so the lens has room for all three zones. These rectangular frames work well.

speaker: Patient
text: I like these dark brown ones. How much are they?

speaker: Optician
text: The frames are two hundred and nineteen. With progressive lenses and anti-glare coating the total would be about four hundred and seventy.

speaker: Patient
text: Does my insurance cover any of that?

speaker: Optician
text: Your plan covers a hundred and fifty toward frames and lenses. So your out of pocket would be around three hundred and twenty.

speaker: Patient
text: That's reasonable. I'll go with the brown ones. When will they be ready?

speaker: Therapist
text: Welcome in. I reviewed the notes from your doctor. You're here for your right shoulder?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes. I had surgery six weeks ago and the doctor said I should start training exercises.

speaker: Therapist
text: Let me see your range of motion. Can you slowly raise your arm as high as comfortable?

speaker: Patient
text: That's about as far as I can go. It gets tight right around here.

speaker: Therapist
text: That's actually pretty good for six weeks. We'll work on gentle stretching first then build up to strengthening.

speaker: Patient
text: How often will I need to come in?

speaker: Therapist
text: I'd recommend twice a week for about eight weeks. I'll also give you exercises to do at home every day.

speaker: Patient
text: That works for me. Is Tuesday and Thursday at nine available?

speaker: Technician
text: Good morning. Have a seat. Can I see your lab order and your ID?

speaker: Patient
text: Here they are. My doctor ordered a complete metabolic panel.

speaker: Technician
text: I see that. Were you fasting for at least eight hours?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes I haven't eaten since ten o'clock last night.

speaker: Technician
text: Perfect. I'm going to draw from your left arm. You'll feel a small pinch. Are you okay with needles?

speaker: Patient
text: I'm a little nervous but I'll be fine. How many vials do you need?

speaker: Technician
text: Just three. It'll be over in less than a minute. Results should be available online within two business days.

speaker: Patient
text: Should I keep the bandage on for a while?

speaker: Specialist
text: Welcome back. Today we're going to fit your new hearing devices and make some adjustments.

speaker: Patient
text: I'm excited but a little nervous. These are my first ones.

speaker: Specialist
text: That's completely normal. I'm going to place the left one first. Tell me how it feels behind your ear.

speaker: Patient
text: It feels a bit snug but not uncomfortable. Everything sounds much louder.

speaker: Specialist
text: I'll turn the volume down slightly. We start at about seventy percent and gradually increase over the next few weeks.

speaker: Patient
text: That's better. My own voice sounds strange though. Is that normal?

speaker: Specialist
text: Very normal. Your brain will adjust in about a week. Wear them at least eight hours a day to help with the adjustment.

speaker: Patient
text: Should I come back if something doesn't feel right before my next appointment?

speaker: Nutritionist
text: Thanks for coming in. I've reviewed the food diary you sent over. Tell me about your goals.

speaker: Client
text: I want to lower my cholesterol. My doctor said it was two forty-five at my last checkup.

speaker: Nutritionist
text: That's definitely something we can work on through diet. I noticed you eat a lot of red meat and fried foods.

speaker: Client
text: I know. I eat out for lunch almost every day. Old habits.

speaker: Nutritionist
text: Let's start with small changes. Could you swap two of those lunches per week for grilled chicken or fish?

speaker: Client
text: I could try that. What about breakfast? I usually skip it.

speaker: Nutritionist
text: Skipping breakfast often leads to overeating at lunch. Try oatmeal with berries. It takes five minutes and helps lower cholesterol.

speaker: Client
text: I'll give it a shot. When should I come back for a follow-up?

speaker: Nurse
text: What brings you in today?

speaker: Patient
text: I woke up with a really sore throat and a fever. My temperature was a hundred and one point four this morning.

speaker: Nurse
text: How long have you been feeling this way?

speaker: Patient
text: Since yesterday evening. It started with a scratchy throat and got worse overnight.

speaker: Nurse
text: Any cough or congestion?

speaker: Patient
text: No cough but my glands feel swollen on both sides of my neck.

speaker: Nurse
text: We'll do a rapid strep test. It only takes about five minutes. Are you allergic to any medications?

speaker: Patient
text: Just penicillin. I break out in a rash.

speaker: Coordinator
text: Welcome. This is your first visit so we'll spend some time going over paperwork and getting to know you.

speaker: Client
text: Okay. I wasn't sure what to expect. How long does this usually take?

speaker: Coordinator
text: About forty-five minutes. I'll ask some general questions about your background and what brought you here today.

speaker: Client
text: I've been having trouble sleeping and feeling anxious at work for the past few months.

speaker: Coordinator
text: I'm glad you reached out. Can you tell me if you've ever spoken to a counselor before?

speaker: Client
text: I saw someone briefly about ten years ago but didn't continue.

speaker: Coordinator
text: That's helpful to know. Based on what you've shared I think you'd benefit from meeting with Doctor Ramirez. She has an opening next Wednesday at four.

speaker: Client
text: That would work. Do I need to bring anything to the first session?

speaker: Pharmacist
text: Hi there. Are you here for a flu shot?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes please. Do I need an appointment?

speaker: Pharmacist
text: No walk-ins are welcome. Can I see your insurance card and a photo ID?

speaker: Customer
text: Here you go. Is the flu shot covered by my insurance?

speaker: Pharmacist
text: Let me check. Yes your plan covers it at no cost. Have you had any reactions to flu shots in the past?

speaker: Customer
text: No never. Just a sore arm for a day or two.

speaker: Pharmacist
text: That's very common. Please fill out this short form and I'll give you the shot in about five minutes.

speaker: Customer
text: Great. Which arm should I roll up my sleeve on?

speaker: Interviewer
text: Thanks for coming in. I see on your resume that you have five years of experience in web development.

speaker: Candidate
text: That's right. Most recently I worked at a startup building their customer-facing dashboard.

speaker: Interviewer
text: What technologies did you use on that project?

speaker: Candidate
text: React and TypeScript on the front end with a Node.js backend and a PostgreSQL database.

speaker: Interviewer
text: We use a similar stack here. How comfortable are you with writing automated tests?

speaker: Candidate
text: Very comfortable. I wrote unit tests and integration tests for about eighty percent of our codebase.

speaker: Interviewer
text: That's great. This role is for a senior developer. The salary range is between a hundred and twenty and a hundred and forty-five thousand. Does that work for you?

speaker: Candidate
text: Yes that's within my range. When would the position start?

speaker: Manager
text: All right everyone let's get started. Sarah can you give us an update on the website redesign?

speaker: Employee
text: Sure. We finished the homepage mockups on Monday. The client reviewed them yesterday and approved the design.

speaker: Manager
text: That's ahead of schedule. When do you think the development phase will wrap up?

speaker: Employee
text: If testing goes smoothly we should have the site ready by March fifteenth.

speaker: Manager
text: Good. Are there any blockers the rest of the team should know about?

speaker: Employee
text: We're still waiting on final product images from the marketing department. We need those by next Friday at the latest.

speaker: Manager
text: I'll follow up with marketing today. Anyone else have updates before we wrap up?

speaker: Employee
text: One more thing. The client asked about adding a live chat feature. Should I put together a cost estimate?

speaker: Account Manager
text: Good morning Andrea. Thanks for making time for this call. I wanted to discuss the project timeline.

speaker: Client
text: Good morning. I actually wanted to bring up the same thing. We've had a change on our end.

speaker: Account Manager
text: Oh okay. What's changed?

speaker: Client
text: Our launch date moved up two weeks to April first. Can your team meet that deadline?

speaker: Account Manager
text: That's tight. We'd need to get all your content and approvals by March fifteenth. Is that realistic on your side?

speaker: Client
text: I can commit to that. Will the earlier deadline affect the cost?

speaker: Account Manager
text: There may be a small rush fee of about ten percent for overtime hours. I'll send you a revised quote by end of day tomorrow.

speaker: Client
text: That sounds fair. Send it over and I'll get approval from my director.

speaker: Guide
text: Welcome to the team. I'm Lisa from HR. Let me show you around the office.

speaker: New Employee
text: Thank you Lisa. This is a lot bigger than I expected.

speaker: Guide
text: This floor has the engineering and design teams. The break room is at the end of the hall on the right.

speaker: New Employee
text: Where will my desk be?

speaker: Guide
text: You'll be in section B near the windows. Your manager Kevin sits right across from you.

speaker: New Employee
text: Great. Where are the meeting rooms?

speaker: Guide
text: There are four meeting rooms on this floor. You can book them through the calendar app on your laptop. IT will set that up this afternoon.

speaker: New Employee
text: And where do I park? I noticed the garage outside.

speaker: Coworker A
text: Hey did you try the new coffee machine? It makes lattes now.

speaker: Coworker B
text: Really? I've been going to the cafe downstairs every morning. This could save me four dollars a day.

speaker: Coworker A
text: I know right. Just press the third button and it even froths the milk.

speaker: Coworker B
text: Nice. Hey did you hear about the company picnic next month?

speaker: Coworker A
text: Yeah June twenty-first at Riverside Park. Are you going to sign up for the softball game?

speaker: Coworker B
text: Maybe. My arm isn't what it used to be. Are they doing teams by department?

speaker: Coworker A
text: I think it's mixed teams. Sign up sheet is on the bulletin board by the elevator.

speaker: Coworker B
text: I'll check it out. Oh the microwave is free. I need to heat up my lunch before the noon meeting.

speaker: Manager
text: Thanks for sitting down with me. Let's go over your performance from this past year.

speaker: Employee
text: I've been looking forward to this. I feel like it was a strong year.

speaker: Manager
text: I agree. Your numbers were excellent. You exceeded your sales target by eighteen percent.

speaker: Employee
text: Thank you. I focused a lot on building relationships with the mid-size accounts this year.

speaker: Manager
text: That showed in the client retention numbers. One area for growth is presenting at team meetings. How do you feel about that?

speaker: Employee
text: Public speaking makes me a bit nervous but I'm willing to work on it.

speaker: Manager
text: We have a great workshop coming up in March. I'd like to nominate you for it. Also I'm recommending a four percent raise effective next month.

speaker: Employee
text: That's really generous. Thank you. I'll definitely sign up for that workshop.

speaker: Trainer
text: Good morning everyone. Today we're learning the new project management software. Has anyone used it before?

speaker: Attendee
text: I've seen it but never used it. Is it similar to the old system?

speaker: Trainer
text: The layout is different but the concepts are the same. Let me share my screen. You should see the main dashboard now.

speaker: Attendee
text: I see it. Where do we create a new project?

speaker: Trainer
text: Click the blue plus button in the top right corner. Then fill in the project name and select your team members.

speaker: Attendee
text: How do we assign tasks to people?

speaker: Trainer
text: Drag the task card to the person's column. You can also set deadlines by clicking the calendar icon. I'll send everyone a quick reference guide after this session.

speaker: Attendee
text: Will this be recorded so we can review it later?

speaker: Coworker A
text: This place has great reviews. Have you been here before?

speaker: Coworker B
text: Once with my family. The pasta is excellent. I had the carbonara.

speaker: Coworker A
text: I'm thinking about the grilled chicken salad. Are we splitting the bill?

speaker: Coworker B
text: Sure that's easiest. Hey did you hear we're getting new monitors for the whole team?

speaker: Coworker A
text: No way. When?

speaker: Coworker B
text: Sometime next week. Twenty-seven inch ultra-wide screens. Kevin put in the request last month.

speaker: Coworker A
text: That's awesome. I've been squinting at my old monitor for two years. What are you getting to drink?

speaker: Coworker B
text: Just water for me. We should head back by one. I have that client call at one fifteen.

speaker: Host
text: Okay everyone. What did we think of this month's book? Who wants to start?

speaker: Member
text: I'll go first. I thought the first half was slow but the ending completely surprised me.

speaker: Host
text: I felt the same way. The twist in chapter fourteen changed everything for me.

speaker: Member
text: Did anyone else notice the parallels between the main character and the author's own life?

speaker: Host
text: Good catch. I read an interview where the author admitted the protagonist is partly autobiographical.

speaker: Member
text: That makes so much sense. So what are we reading next month?

speaker: Host
text: I have three suggestions. A mystery by Ruth Ware a memoir by Trevor Noah or a science fiction novel by Becky Chambers. Let's take a vote.

speaker: Member
text: I vote for the Ruth Ware mystery. I've been wanting to read more of her work.

speaker: Host
text: Hey welcome. Glad you could make it. Grab a plate and help yourself.

speaker: Neighbor
text: Thanks for inviting us. Everything smells amazing. What's on the grill?

speaker: Host
text: Burgers hot dogs and some veggie kebabs. There's also a cooler of drinks by the table.

speaker: Neighbor
text: I brought a potato salad. Where should I put it?

speaker: Host
text: Right on the long table with the other sides. The Hendersons brought their famous coleslaw too.

speaker: Neighbor
text: Great. By the way have you met the new family that moved in on the corner?

speaker: Host
text: Not yet. They have two young kids I think. I left a welcome card in their mailbox last week.

speaker: Neighbor
text: That's nice of you. Oh there's Mark and Susan. I'll go say hello.

speaker: Guest A
text: Happy birthday! How does it feel to be forty?

speaker: Guest B
text: Ha thanks. Honestly I don't feel any different than thirty-nine. I'm just glad everyone could come.

speaker: Guest A
text: This is a great turnout. There must be thirty people here.

speaker: Guest B
text: My wife organized the whole thing. I had no idea until I walked in.

speaker: Guest A
text: A surprise party? That's impressive. She kept it a complete secret.

speaker: Guest B
text: Totally. I thought we were just going out to dinner. Then I walked in and everyone yelled surprise.

speaker: Guest A
text: Did you see the cake? It's shaped like a guitar because she knows you've been taking lessons.

speaker: Guest B
text: I saw it. She even got the bakery on Oak Street to make it. That place does incredible work.

speaker: Coordinator
text: Welcome to the food bank orientation. Thank you all for signing up to volunteer.

speaker: Volunteer
text: Happy to be here. What will we be doing today?

speaker: Coordinator
text: Today I'll walk you through our sorting process and food safety guidelines. Then we'll do a practice run.

speaker: Volunteer
text: How often do volunteers usually come in?

speaker: Coordinator
text: Most of our regulars come once a week. Saturdays from nine to noon are our busiest shifts. We serve about two hundred families per week.

speaker: Volunteer
text: I could commit to every other Saturday. Do I need to sign up each time?

speaker: Coordinator
text: You can set a recurring schedule in our app. It'll send you a reminder the day before. You'll also need to wear closed-toe shoes and tie back long hair.

speaker: Volunteer
text: Got it. Is parking available here or should I take the bus?

speaker: Friend A
text: Can you believe that play? The shortstop made an incredible diving catch.

speaker: Friend B
text: I know. That saved at least two runs. Hey do you want another hot dog?

speaker: Friend A
text: Sure. And can you grab me a lemonade too? Here's a twenty.

speaker: Friend B
text: Got it. The line was pretty long last time. I'll probably miss the next inning.

speaker: Friend A
text: No rush. It's only the fifth inning. The score is still three to one.

speaker: Friend B
text: I think our team can pull ahead if Rodriguez comes up to bat with runners on.

speaker: Friend A
text: He's been on fire this season. Twelve home runs in the last thirty games.

speaker: Friend B
text: Okay I'm heading to the concession stand. Save my seat. I'll be right back.

speaker: Friend A
text: So what are we watching tonight? I brought popcorn and candy.

speaker: Friend B
text: I was thinking either a comedy or that new thriller everyone's been talking about.

speaker: Friend A
text: What's the thriller called? Is it the one with Sandra Bullock?

speaker: Friend B
text: No it's called The Last Signal. It came out on streaming last Friday.

speaker: Friend A
text: Oh I've heard good things about that one. Is it really scary though? I don't do well with jump scares.

speaker: Friend B
text: It's more suspenseful than scary. No jump scares from what I've read. Should I put it on?

speaker: Friend A
text: Sure let's try it. If it's too intense we can always switch. Do you want butter on the popcorn?

speaker: Friend B
text: Yes please. And grab a couple of blankets from the closet. It's cold in here.

speaker: Manager
text: Hi there. Are you interested in getting a garden plot this season?

speaker: Gardener
text: Yes. My apartment doesn't have any outdoor space so this would be perfect.

speaker: Manager
text: We have a few plots available. The small ones are four feet by eight feet and cost forty dollars per year.

speaker: Gardener
text: That sounds just right. What's included with the plot?

speaker: Manager
text: You get access to the shared tool shed water spigots and the compost bins. We also hold monthly workshops.

speaker: Gardener
text: Are there any rules about what I can grow?

speaker: Manager
text: No restrictions on vegetables or flowers. We just ask that you keep your plot weeded and don't use any chemical pesticides.

speaker: Gardener
text: That's fine with me. When does the growing season officially start?

speaker: Instructor
text: Welcome to beginner salsa. Is this your first dance class?

speaker: Student
text: Yes. I've never taken any kind of dance class before. I'm pretty nervous.

speaker: Instructor
text: Don't worry at all. Everyone here started with zero experience. The first thing we learn is the basic step.

speaker: Student
text: Do I need a partner or can I come alone?

speaker: Instructor
text: You can come alone. We rotate partners throughout the class so everyone dances with everyone.

speaker: Student
text: That's a relief. How long is each session?

speaker: Instructor
text: One hour every Wednesday at seven. The eight-week series is a hundred and twenty dollars or you can drop in for eighteen per class.

speaker: Student
text: I'll start with the drop-in option and see how I like it. Should I wear special shoes?

speaker: Clerk
text: Good evening. Welcome to the Riverside Inn. Are you checking in?

speaker: Guest
text: Yes I'm sorry I'm arriving so late. My flight was delayed three hours. The reservation is under Martinez.

speaker: Clerk
text: No problem at all. I have your reservation right here. A queen room for three nights?

speaker: Guest
text: That's correct. Is the restaurant still open? I haven't had dinner yet.

speaker: Clerk
text: The restaurant closes at ten but room service is available until midnight. I can leave a menu in your room.

speaker: Guest
text: That would be wonderful. What floor am I on?

speaker: Clerk
text: Room four-twelve on the fourth floor. The elevator is just past the lobby. Breakfast is from six thirty to ten in the dining room.

speaker: Guest
text: Thank you. Could I also get a late checkout on my last day? My flight isn't until four.

speaker: Agent
text: Welcome back. Are you returning a vehicle today?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes. It's the blue Camry parked in slot seventeen. Here are the keys.

speaker: Agent
text: Thank you. Let me walk around and do a quick inspection. Did the car run well for you?

speaker: Customer
text: It ran great. I did put a lot of miles on it though. I drove about six hundred miles total.

speaker: Agent
text: That's fine. Your plan includes unlimited mileage. I do see the gas tank is at about a quarter. You prepaid for a full tank right?

speaker: Customer
text: Yes I chose the prepaid fuel option when I picked it up.

speaker: Agent
text: Then you're all set. No additional charges. Your final receipt will be emailed to the address on file within twenty-four hours.

speaker: Customer
text: Perfect. Can you point me toward the airport shuttle?

speaker: Agent
text: How can I help you?

speaker: Passenger
text: I need two tickets to Philadelphia on the next available train.

speaker: Agent
text: The next train departs at two forty-five from platform three. Would you like coach or business class?

speaker: Passenger
text: What's the price difference?

speaker: Agent
text: Coach is forty-seven dollars each and business class is seventy-two. Business class includes wider seats and a quiet car option.

speaker: Passenger
text: Coach is fine for both tickets. Can we pick our seats?

speaker: Agent
text: Seating is first come first served in coach. I'd suggest boarding early for the best selection. The trip takes about an hour and forty minutes.

speaker: Passenger
text: Thank you. Is there food available on the train?

speaker: Officer
text: Good afternoon. Passports and identification for everyone in the vehicle please.

speaker: Traveler
text: Here are our passports. There are two of us.

speaker: Officer
text: What is the purpose of your visit?

speaker: Traveler
text: We're on vacation. We're spending four days in Vancouver visiting friends.

speaker: Officer
text: Where will you be staying?

speaker: Traveler
text: At our friend's home on West Eighth Avenue. I have the address written down if you need it.

speaker: Officer
text: That won't be necessary. Are you bringing any food alcohol or tobacco into the country?

speaker: Traveler
text: No. Just our personal belongings and clothes.

speaker: Guide
text: Welcome to the historic downtown walking tour. My name is Marcus and I'll be your guide for the next ninety minutes.

speaker: Tourist
text: Hi Marcus. Is it okay to take photos along the way?

speaker: Guide
text: Absolutely. I'll point out the best photo spots. We're starting here at the old courthouse which was built in eighteen seventy-six.

speaker: Tourist
text: It's beautiful. Is it still a working courthouse?

speaker: Guide
text: No it was converted into a museum in nineteen ninety-five. Our next stop is the waterfront which is about a five minute walk from here.

speaker: Tourist
text: How many stops are there on the tour total?

speaker: Guide
text: Seven stops in all. We'll end at the farmer's market where you'll have free time to explore. I recommend the fresh cider stand.

speaker: Tourist
text: That sounds wonderful. Do you have a map of the route we can follow along with?

speaker: Staff
text: Welcome aboard. May I see your boarding pass and photo ID?

speaker: Passenger
text: Here you go. This is our first cruise. We're very excited.

speaker: Staff
text: You're going to have a wonderful time. Your cabin is on deck seven room seven-fourteen. Take the elevators to the right.

speaker: Passenger
text: Thank you. What time do we set sail?

speaker: Staff
text: We depart at five o'clock. There's a mandatory safety drill at four fifteen. You'll hear an announcement and head to your muster station.

speaker: Passenger
text: Where is our muster station?

speaker: Staff
text: Station D on deck three. It's marked on the map behind your cabin door. Dinner tonight is at seven in the main dining room on deck five.

speaker: Passenger
text: Is the dining room formal or can we wear casual clothes?

speaker: Guide
text: Good morning everyone. Welcome to the Hollywood sightseeing tour. We'll be making six stops over the next three hours.

speaker: Tourist
text: Can we get off the bus at each stop?

speaker: Guide
text: Yes this is a hop-on hop-off tour. You can stay as long as you want and catch the next bus. They come every twenty minutes.

speaker: Tourist
text: Where's the best stop for taking pictures of the Hollywood sign?

speaker: Guide
text: Stop number four at Griffith Observatory has the best view. I'd recommend spending about forty-five minutes there.

speaker: Tourist
text: And where does the tour end?

speaker: Guide
text: It loops back here to Hollywood Boulevard. The last bus of the day leaves Griffith at five thirty. Make sure you don't miss it.

speaker: Tourist
text: Thank you. Is there a restroom on the bus?

speaker: Driver
text: Are you the one who called about the breakdown? Is this your silver SUV?

speaker: Motorist
text: Yes that's me. Thank you for getting here so quickly.

speaker: Driver
text: No problem. The dispatch said your engine overheated. Did you see any steam or warning lights?

speaker: Motorist
text: The temperature gauge went into the red and then steam started coming from under the hood.

speaker: Driver
text: Sounds like it could be the radiator or a blown hose. I'll need to tow it. Where's your preferred shop?

speaker: Motorist
text: I usually go to Valley Auto on Pine Street. Is that within the towing range?

speaker: Driver
text: That's about eight miles from here. Your plan covers up to fifteen miles so you're good. Grab your personal items and you can ride in the cab with me.

speaker: Motorist
text: Let me get my bag and my phone charger. Will the shop be open when we arrive?
